summary: Each year, the Department of Homeland Security invests billions of dollars in major acquisitions such as aircraft and surveillance technology. We reviewed DHS's portfolio of major acquisitions and found that, in 2017, more than half of its programs needed more time and money than initially planned—an increase from 2016. DHS has strengthened its policies for managing acquisitions as a portfolio—a practice that emphasizes prioritization of...
title: Homeland Security Acquisitions: Leveraging Programs' Results Could Further DHS's Progress to Improve Portfolio Management
